Skip to main contentOpen Navigation MenuMenuStory SavedTo revisit this article, visit My Profile, then View saved stories.Close AlertCloseStory SavedTo revisit this article, select My Account, then View saved storiesClose AlertCloseSign InSearchRecipesCookingCultureShoppingRestaurantsBA MarketVideosPodcastMerch ShopcultureThe Test Kitchen Swears By This Mini Food ProcessorSmall but mighty—and really, really clutch.By Zoë SessumsMay 7, 2019FacebookTwitterEmailPhoto by Chelsie CraigFacebookTwitterEmailOne of the easiest ways to turn a sad, miscellaneous ingredient into a meal you can actually brag about is to serve it with something quick and dippable, spreadable, or schmearable. One more piece of bread? Toast it, and whip up your own butter. Got a few hardboiled eggs? Make your own mayo and mix it into egg salad. Trying to finish the last of your greens? Put it to good use by pairing it with a creamy miso dressing. Got veggies but nothing to eat ’em with? How about some homemade hummus? The thing that makes all of this actually fast and easy? A Mini-Prep food processor.“I love my tiny food processor,” senior food editor Molly Baz says as she pulls out her Cuisinart Mini-Prep Plus and cradles it in her arms. “I keep my three-cup on the counter because it barely takes up space, and I end up using it all the time,” adds food editor Anna Stockwell.That’s because any task that requires chopping, slicing, or shredding can be tackled with a food processor, whose ridged and razor-sharp blades cut through ingredients as a chef’s knife would—but a lot faster. Pesto is ready in moments, with the mini prep taking on the hard pine nuts, sticky garlic, and tender basil all in one go. Dressings too, like this walnut-anchovy one. In fact, its ability to handle those different textures all at once is the machine’s biggest advantage over something like a blender, which, with its super fast motor, strives to bring uniformity to each ingredient.With a mini food processor, things still get done quick—but you won’t have to sacrifice consistency for speed.Buy it: Cuisinart Mini-Prep Plus Food Processor, $32 on AmazonAll products featured on Bonappetit.com are independently selected by our editors.
